title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live Monday 19 February - BBC News
summary: gay couple left meal after kiss complaint .
pm theresa may visits derby college .
pair released over zebra crossing crash .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: dedicated live coverage has ended for today but some breaking news , sport and travel will continue to appear through the night .
we will be back again tomorrow at 08:00 .

documents.title: notts county ponder move for ranger
text: notts county ponder move for ranger

documents.title: weather : a dry and bright start to tuesday
text: it will be cloudy with some patchy rain and drizzle this evening .
this will die away overnight , leaving it mainly dry with some mist in places .
it will be a dry and bright start to tuesday with some long spells of sunshine - however cloud will increase possibly giving us some drizzle in the afternoon .
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: your comments : girl , 12 , attacked for phone
text: lots of you on facebook have been commenting on the video of a 12-year-old girl being robbed in derby .
charlotte carter said : `` wow what a girl , i 'm so sad this has happened to her but what a brave strong willed girl fighting it out . ''
faye rowland-mcdonald wrote : `` this is absolutely horrific i hope the poor , brave girl recovers quickly . ''
robert cauldwell added : `` good girl , i bet he did n't expect your determination to hang on to your phone .
always try and keep your phone hidden . ''
author: Facebook

documents.title: teen blackmails teacher out of £ 10k
text: a teenager blackmailed his former teacher into handing over £ 10,000 which he spent on a car and designer clothes after alleging the pair engaged in an inappropriate relationship .
author: Leicester Mercury

documents.title: theresa may dons 'wild ' footwear in derby
text: the pm wore some `` fierce '' shoes for her speech in derby earlier - maybe she was hoping they 'd help make her a `` roaring '' success
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: girl , 12 , violently attacked for phone
text: girl , 12 , violently attacked for phone

documents.title: woman , 20 , held for murder after man died
text: woman , 20 , held for murder after man died

documents.title: dozens of people from different faiths join mosque open day
text: more than 15 mosques in the east midlands welcomed people from different faiths and backgrounds to an open day to break down barriers between communities .
the national initiative , visit my mosque , was launched to help people better understand islam .
visitors were able to have a tour of the mosque , listen to talks and try on islamic clothing during the annual event yesterday .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: watch : girl violently attacked for phone
text: cctv footage has captured the moment a 12-year-old girl was the victim of a `` horrific '' robbery in derby .
it happened on cambridge street at about 16:40 yesterday , when the child was on her way to the local shops on an errand for her mum .
the man struggled violently with her and stole her phone .
the cctv footage captures the horrific incident taking place .
i realise that the quality is not the best but we have released it quickly in the hope that someone will recognise the man .
the 12-year-old victim has been very brave but was attacked for apparently no other reason than to steal her phone , a rose gold iphone 6s . ''
the man , who spoke with a `` european accent '' , has been described as white/tanned , aged between 16 and 19 , about 5ft 6in tall , and of a slim build .
his hair is black , shaved on the sides and longer at the top , with a v-shape at the back .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: soldiers deny being part of banned neo-nazi group
text: two british soldiers have pleaded not guilty to membership of the banned neo-nazi group national action .
mark barrett ( 24 , and mikko vevhilainen , 33 , entered their pleas during a preliminary hearing at birmingham crown court .
a third defendant - a 23-year-old man who can not be identified for legal reasons - has yet to enter a plea to the membership charge .
the three men , who are all in custody , will stand trial on 5 march .
private barrett , from cottesmore in rutland , appeared in court in person , while lance corporal vehvilainen , from sennybridge camp in powys , appeared by video link from hmp belmarsh .

at an earlier preliminary hearing l/cpl vehvilainen pleaded not guilty to two counts of posting material online that was threatening , abusive or insulting , thereby stirring up racial hatred , and one count of possession of a document likely to be useful to a person committing or preparing an act of terrorism .
the document is alleged to have been 2083 : a european declaration of independence , written by anders breivik ( below ) , who killed 77 people in two terror attacks in norway in 2011 .
he is also accused of possession of a pepper spray .

the third defendant has previously pleaded not guilty to two counts of possession of a document likely to be useful to a person committing or preparing an act of terrorism , and one count of distributing a terrorist publication .
national action became the first far-right group to be banned in the uk when it was proscribed under anti-terror laws in december 2016 .
author: Daniel De Simone
BBC Home Affairs producer

documents.title: church 's sports direct criticism praised
text: church 's sports direct criticism praised

documents.title: gay couple left meal after kiss complaint
text: gay couple left meal after kiss complaint

documents.title: in theresa may 's visit to derby college
text: the prime minister has been speaking at derby college , calling for better value for students across the country .
on her visit to the roundhouse , she also spoke about the need to end `` outdated attitudes '' that favour university over technical education .
labour says it would abolish fees and bring back maintenance grants .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: 'holidaying students ' to miss pm 's speech in derby
text: political editor laura kuenssberg tweets
speech is in v cold but v nice library in a college in derby - unfortunately its on half term so only a handful of actual students here to hear it
zzzzz
it 's called planning .
foodie racists blocked ?
i do think some foods are superior to others , i do n't apologise for that .
i put in a full-stop , so as not to confuse some readers .
lol
was that not the point .
cameras are so .
students were not essential just setting for sound bites .
the disingenuous noise made by speeches for lazy broadcasters in hock to the tory gov
half-attended , half-baked , half-hearted .
half-arsed , as ever
only the half-witted tories could organise a flagship policy announcement by the pm on students during , errrrrr , half-term !
ready made excuse for no one turning up
more likely deliberately so to ensure control over who 's there .
remember those ludicrous hand- audiences of apparatchiks and shills during her dire election campaign ?
says it all , could n't organise a p up in a brewery !
do u honestly think most students would want to listen to maybots waffle ?
you mean she 's decided to make a speech about education , to sell the idea to students and half term at a college to make it ?
and she wonders why people call the tories incompetent ? ?
half term ?
it 's the perfect time for may to avoid the risk of meeting any angry students .
i remember she avoided two-way communication with the public in the lead-up to the election .
half term over in england now , laura .
not on '' .
laura is right half term is either last week , this week or both weeks , for a great number of institutions in england .
# factcheck
hot air kick into grass study , fracking green may bored ?
we are .
another empty speech in an empty room .
she ca n't face a real audience .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: breakingderby-based meat supplier goes into administration
text: a meat supplier being investigated by the food standards agency has gone into administration with the loss of almost 270 jobs .
kpmg has been appointed as administrators to derby-based russell hume limited .
its meat products were recalled last month and chains including wetherspoon took them off their menus .
the fsa said its investigation concerned russell hume 's failure to comply with food hygiene regulations .
author: BBC Business News

documents.title: police welcome puppy arrival
text: leicestershire police welcomed some new arrivals over the weekend - police dog orla gave birth to five puppies .
the force 's dog section has described her as a `` fantastic , loving and attentive mother '' .
last week there was an appeal for donations of puppy items like clean newspapers , unused puppy blankets or puppy training pads .
well , the dog lovers of leicestershire did n't let them down .
leicestershire police have thanked everyone who donated the items and said clean , unstapled newspapers are still needed .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: nottingham graduate lands job with meghan markle
text: a university of nottingham graduate has been handed a top job working with prince harry and meghan markle .
amy pickerill ( right ) , who read history at the university , will be working on ms markle 's official diary .
her role will also involve handling any official correspondence prince harry 's bride-to-be may receive .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: stuart broad mocks dad 's clothing choice
text: nottinghamshire and england cricketer stuart broad tweets
my dads dress sense .
the gift that keeps on giving .
@ twitterid
let 's hope he gave you a bit of grief for these socks then
present from my mum
we 've all been there
nothing wrong with those socks !
@ twitterid now we know who you model yourself on .
does he realise what he looks like ?
did he get dressed in the dark ?
wow .
that 's very bold statement chris !
nice car though
nice car sense though !
very comfortable !
i would n't let him get into that nice car with that outfit on !
back to the house to change .
sharp
stuart he 's trying to look like michael portillo
with those wheels , who cares ?
dad 's i bet he could n't care less when he 's about to hop into his db11 .
his taste in cars looks alright !
nice strides and motor
nice dress and your father .
you need to work on getting the subject in the middle of the photo .
the car seems to be getting in the way
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: new life for rescued blind terrier
text: last summer tina the terrier was found by the rspca at a house in nottinghamshire .
she was living in a crate , along with 40 other dogs , and had a `` nasty eye infection '' .
she was rescued by the charity , along with most of the other dogs , but she eventually went blind .
she found a new home though - with julie iliff and her westie-cross tyke in swadlincote .
she said : i do n't think we chose her , i think she chose us .
`` i truly believe that any dog , if they 've got disability or not , deserves a second chance and a loving home and that 's what she 's got . ''
julie is now trying to raise £ 5,000 to take tina to a specialist who might be able to help her see again .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: police investigated over failure to locate rape victim
text: the police watchdog is investigating the way leicestershire police handled a call connected to the rape and attempted murder of a woman in leicester .
charlie pearce was jailed for a minimum of 11 years last week for an attack in victoria park last year .
people nearby witnessed the initial struggle and called 999 , but a police patrol failed to find the woman .
she was found with `` truly dreadful '' injuries about an hour later by a passing cyclist .
leicestershire police has referred itself to the independent office for police conduct ( iopc ) .

following a mandatory referral received from leicestershire police on 14 july 2017 we started an independent investigation in connection with the force 's handling of the incident and that is currently ongoing .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: briton christie making 'good progress '
text: briton christie making 'good progress '

documents.title: nottingham family performs at baftas
text: a family from nottingham wowed audiences at the baftas last night .
former young musician of the year , sheku kanneh mason , was joined by some of his siblings at the glitzy event .
the family , from mapperley park , performed as the british academy remembered those the industry has lost in the past year .
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: lead stolen from school and church
text: a church and a school have been targeted by lead thieves .
lead flashing was stolen from the roof of pilsley ce primary school at the end of january , police said .
metal was also taken from the rood of st. martins church ( on the nook at stoney middleton .
it is believed this happened some time between thursday 2 february and sunday 11 february .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: new owners take over hinckley bakery
text: for more than 80 years connors of hinckley has been selling baked goods to people in the town .
however , the firm has now been passed on to another family - the wrobels .
the polish family want to continue baking traditional products at the store , but are also open to the idea of introducing some new food inspired by their home country .
slawek wrobel , who runs the business with his wife and two children , told the bbc he 's been baking since he was a teenager and that it makes him feel `` wonderful '' .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: tonne of litter collected in a42 cleanse
text: over a tonne of litter was removed from the a42 in leicestershire over the weekend .
six slip roads were cleaned up as part of north west leicestershire district council 's annual a42 cleanse .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: nottingham envoy set for eu talks
text: a delegation from nottingham are meeting the european union 's chief brexit negotiator , michel barnier , in brussels .
along with nine other uk cities , they will be looking at how the interests of local communities and businesses can best be met in the lead-up to , and after , brexit .
councillor jon collins , the leader of nottingham city council , said : `` we want to put a strong positive case for the importance of the uk 's city-regions continuing to work with europe .
`` this is n't about undermining the current brexit negotiations .
`` it 's vital that the uk 's city regions maintain open , productive relationships with other european countries and markets post-brexit .
we 're leaving the eu not europe . ''
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: 'i broke my neck but still won gold '
text: 'i broke my neck but still won gold '
author: Caroline Chapman
BBC Sport

documents.title: police arrest 11th person in murder investigation
text: police investigating the murder of a leicester jeweller have made yet another arrest .
the 24-year-old woman is the eleventh person to be detained by the force in connection with the death of ramniklal jogiya .
she was arrested this morning on sus of conspiracy to commit kidnap and robbery .
mr jogiya 's body was found in gaulby lane in stoughton on thursday 25 january .
so far , four men have been charged with robbery and the kidnap of mr jogiya .
no one has been charged with his murder .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: 'incorrect coupling ' caused runaway trailer
text: a railway trailer became detached from an engine and rolled for about a mile because a linch pin was wrongly fitted , an investigation has concluded .
it was being pulled by a small rail tractor between edale and bamford in may 2017 when it became uncoupled .
this was because a linch pin that secured the towbar pin had `` almost certainly '' been attached `` in the wrong orientation , '' a report for rail accident investigation branch ( raib ) concludes .
no one was injured as a result of the uncoupling , nor was there any significant damage to the railway .
however , following its investigation , the raib has published a number of recommendations which centre on staff guidance and training .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: church of england slams sports direct 's failings
text: sports direct has been criticised by the church of england over its treatment of factory workers and governance failings .

the shirebrook-based retailer , which is owned by newcastle united chief mike ashley , has faced a number of difficult questions over working conditions , which were described by unions as `` victorian '' .
press association understands the church , which has a minority shareholding in the company , wrote to the retailer echoing similar concerns .
it also made its disapproval clear at the group 's agm , voting against the re-election of both chairman keith hellawell and chief executive mr ashley in 2017 .
the church of england declined to comment .
author: Press Association

documents.title: murder investigation after man 's death
text: a murder investigation has been launched following the death of a man found injured in hucknall .
police were called to strathmore close in the town at about 05:40 yesterday where the injured man was found .
he was taken to hospital but later died .
a 20-year-old woman has been arrested on sus of his murder .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: briton christie in 'fight against time '
text: briton christie in 'fight against time '

documents.title: project on black miners comes to wales
text: project on black miners comes to wales

documents.title: pair released over zebra crossing crash
text: two people arrested after a hit-and-run in leicester have been released from police custody .
a 32-year-old man and 26-year-old woman were arrested after a man was knocked over on a zebra crossing on st peter 's road on thursday 8 february .
the man has been released without charge and the woman has been released while police continue to investigate further .
the 61-year-old victim is still recovering in hospital .
police have recovered a vehicle in connection with the crash .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC News

documents.title: 'difficult week ' for health service starting to ease
text: nhs bosses say the health service in parts of nottinghamshire remains under pressure , but it has downgraded the level of alert .
opel 4 status , formerly known as black alert , had been in effect at nottingham university hospitals trust ( nuh ) since last monday .
it was extended to to include council-run health services and the ambulance service over the weekend .
the alert has now been reduced to opel 3 .
dr hugh porter , chair of the nottingham city clinical commissoning group , admitted it had been a `` difficult week '' .
author: BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: pm set for visit to derbyshire
text: the prime minister will be in derbyshire later to announce an independent review of university tuition fees and student finance .
for many students , theresa may will say , `` the level of fees charged do not relate to the cost or quality of the course '' .
she will also argue for an end to `` outdated attitudes '' that favour university over technical education .
labour says it would abolish fees and bring back maintenance grants .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: watch : duo set to emulate torvill and dean ?
text: nottingham 's nick buckland and his partner penny coomes are through to the final day of the ice dance competition at the winter olym
the pair scored 68.36 in the short dance and finished 10th with the top 20 competing in tuesday 's free dance .
the pair 's routine was choreographed by another of nottingham 's favourite sons , christopher dean , who won gold with jayne torvill in 1984 .
coomes and buckland are making their third appearance at a winter games , two years after coomes smashed her kneecap into eight pieces and was told she would never skate again .
they will now compete in the free dance on tuesday , starting at 01:00 gmt , with the medals awarded to the pairs with the highest cumulative score over the two dances .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: concern over 17-week roadworks in newark
text: a new one-way system has come into effect on one of newark 's busiest roads .
castle gate will be one way only for over four months , as severn trent starts the next stage of its work to improve sewers .

neil stevens , who owns a cafe in the town , said : `` if they [ shoppers ] come into town and see that there are big traffic problems , which there can be in newark anyway , they 'll be put off from visiting . ''
severn trent has said it is working to minimise disruption and is putting on free shuttle buses .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: weather : outlook for the east midlands
text: here 's rich with today 's forecast .

documents.title: nottingham 's cabs to get phone app and new livery
text: nottingham 's is set to become the first city outside london to introduce a phone app to book a hackney cab .
the service , which will go live on 1 march , will allow for cashless payment .
the city council also hopes that it will be safer for passengers as journeys and drivers are logged in the app .
the colour of hackney cabs in the city is also changing , from dark green to black and white .
a small number of ultra low emission vehicles are also being ordered , as the city looks to improve air quality standards .
councillor toby neal , from nottingham city council , said : `` for too long , taxis have been the poor relation in nottingham 's integrated transport network .
`` that 's all changing now , with better customer standards , smart new vehicles and a brand new app to make it safe and easy for modern passengers to use the city 's large fleet of hackney cabs
`` it means we will no longer have cabs churning out exhaust fumes while sitting in the rank , so it benefits everyone in the city , not just taxi passengers . ''
author: BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: travel : latest from region 's roads
text: here 's how it is looking on the region 's roads :
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News

documents.title: good morning : welcome to today 's live updates
text: good morning and welcome along to monday across derbyshire , leicestershire , nottinghamshire and rutland .
amy woodfield and i will be with you until later bringing you the best of the region 's news , sport , weather and travel .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC News
